name: Francesca Stern Woodman
caption: Front of dust jacket of 2011 book Francesca Woodman
summary: Francesca Stern Woodman (April 3, 1958 â€“ January 19, 1981) was an American photographer best known for her black and white pictures featuring either herself or female models. Many of her photographs show women, naked or clothed, blurred (due to movement and long exposure times), merging with their surroundings, or whose faces are obscured. Her work continues to be the subject of much critical acclaim and attention, years after she died by suicide at the age of 22, in 1981.
